bill_title: prohibit certain persons from using the title veterinary technician.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to prohibit certain persons from using the title veterinary technician. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 36-12 be amended with a NEW SECTION: A person who is not registered as a veterinary technician by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners, or whose registration is suspended or revoked, may not: (1) Assume or use the title veterinary technician; or (2) Advertise or otherwise represent oneself as a veterinary technician. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to prohibit certain persons from using the title veterinary technician. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 36-12 be amended with a NEW SECTION: A person who is not registered as a veterinary technician by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners, or whose registration is suspended or revoked, may not: (1) Assume or use the title veterinary technician; or (2) Advertise or otherwise represent oneself as a veterinary technician. A veterinarian may not advertise or otherwise represent an employee as a veterinary technician unless the employee is registered by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners as a veterinary technician. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

An Act to prohibit certain persons from using the title veterinary technician. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 36-12 be amended with a NEW SECTION: A person who is not registered as a veterinary technician by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners, or whose registration is suspended or revoked, may not: (1) Assume or use the title veterinary technician; or (2) Advertise or otherwise represent oneself as a veterinary technician. A veterinarian may not advertise or otherwise represent an employee as a veterinary technician unless the employee is registered by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners as a veterinary technician. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 36-12 be amended with a NEW SECTION: Prior to July 1, 2025, a person who is not registered as a veterinary technician by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners may not assume or use the title veterinary technician unless the person: (1) Has successfully completed a veterinary technician course of study approved by the board; and (2) Submits a notarized document to the board from the person's employing veterinarian certifying that the person: (a) Has at least five years of practical experience working under the supervision of the veterinarian; and (b) Has agreed to become registered as a veterinary technician under chapter 36-12 by July 1, 2025. A veterinarian may advertise or otherwise represent an employee as a veterinary technician who satisfies the requirements of this section. Section 3. Section 1 of this Act is effective July 1, 2025.
